intro: Alcea africana, commonly known as the African hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a contrasting yellow center. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Alcea africana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas.
